title: Bug 12398 - Accessibility problems
description: When launching the Help view, the tab key does not have any effect unless I first click on one of the 'live' areas such as the banner with the tool buttons, the nav frame, or the content frame.
OB: On March 26, 2002, on a Windows 2000 system, when I launch the Help view, the tab key does not have any effect unless I first click on one of the 'live' areas such as the banner with the tool buttons, the nav frame, or the content frame.
EB: When launching the Help view, the tab key should work without requiring any initial clicks on the 'live' areas.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Launch the Help view.
2. Try to navigate using the tab key without clicking on any 'live' areas.

Expected result:
- The tab key should navigate through the elements in the Help view.

Observed result:
- The tab key does not have any effect unless you first click on one of the 'live' areas.
